variant.question: The surface before a runway threshold is paved and exceeds 60 m in length. It is NOT suitable for the normal movement of aircraft. What should the entire length before the threshold be marked with?

options.text: Crosses
Chequered flags
Chevrons
Arrows

variant.question: A pattern "B" runway-holding position marking at an intersection of a taxiway and a precision approach RWY shall be supplemented..

options.text: only with a runway designation sign.
with a taxiway designation sign.
with a category II or III holding position sign, though for CAT I runways a sign is NOT mandatory.
with a category I, II or III holding position sign, as appropriate.

variant.question: An aircraft is moving on the apron. What marking is used to warn the pilot that the shoulders of the surface are non-load-bearing?

options.text: A pair of solid lines in the same colour as the taxiway centre line marking.
One solid line in the same colour as the taxiway centre line marking.
One solid line in the same colour as the runway centre line marking.
A pair of solid lines in the same colour as the runway centre line marking.

variant.question: To minimize damage to aircraft, airfield signs shall be...

options.text: frangible
rigid
metal
flexible

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct regarding the markings used to indicate that a runway or a taxiway is closed?

options.text: White crosses for runways and yellow crosses for taxiways.
Yellow crosses for runways only closed to operations by aircraft with a take-off mass greater 5700 kg.
Yellow crosses for runways and white crosses for taxiways.
White crosses for runways and taxiways.
